HDG.LA.content: what is so bidden is commanded to arrive from out of the dif-ference into the dif-ference > primal calling, nature of speaking, authentic bidding

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LA.linkedContent: what is so bidden is commanded to arrive from out of the dif-ference into the dif-ference > primal calling, nature of speaking, authentic bidding

HDG.BT.content: Heidegger asks whether there’s a manifest circularity in method that will ask about Being by asking Dasein, the entity each of us is himself > no, he replies, factically there is no circle, one can determine nature of entities in their Being w/out explicit concept of meaning of Being at one’s disposal
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Heidegger asks whether there’s a manifest circularity in method that will ask about Being by asking Dasein, the entity each of us is himself > no, he replies, factically there is no circle, one can determine nature of entities in their Being w/out explicit concept of meaning of Being at one’s disposal

HDG.BT.content: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

HDG.BT.linkedContent: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])

HDG.WM.content: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]

HDG.WM.content: going beyond beings occurs in essence of Dasein > this going beyond is metaphysics itself—thus, metaphysics belongs to “nature of the human being” > “because the truth of metaphysics dwells in this abyssal ground [hermeneutic circle of Dasein & metaphysics] it stands in closest proximity to the constantly lurking possibility of deepest error” > [but philosophy was born?] the getting under way of metaphysics, the coming to itself of philosophy, to its explicit tasks

HDG.IWM.content: as long as man understands himself as rational animal, metaphysics belongs (as Kant says) to nature of man

HDG.FS.content: that opposite of monde means impure (immonde) preserves something of Heraclitus’ “world” > fundamental relation of Greek language to nature: leaving nature open in its radiance (Strahlenden) vs. modern era: making nature’s appearances easily calculable

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: that opposite of monde means impure (immonde) preserves something of Heraclitus’ “world” > fundamental relation of Greek language to nature: leaving nature open in its radiance (Strahlenden) vs. modern era: making nature’s appearances easily calculable

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

HDG.FS.content: for Hölderlin, to name is to call (Rufen), not to make a proposition > [unpoetic nature of Greek interpretation of language exposed, no higher poetry than in Greece!] > conception of saying (Sagens) as proposition (Aussagen) prevents access to essence of poetry

HDG.FS.content: [machine & event?] can a thinker ever reconcile these 2 “realms” that have grown foreign to one another: “technologically dominable nature of science” and “natural nature of the…dwelling of man” [reflections on Gelassenheit, comportment (Haltung) of “self-joining (Sicheinfügens),” cautious sheltering, opening to secret (Geheimnis)]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.content: Descartes/Pascal laugh about “motus est actus…” because can’t view what showed itself clearly to Aristotle: kinēsis, movedness as phenomenon > since Galileo, phora masters entire field, mathematical project of nature on basis (aufgrund) of homogenous space [nature as calculable, as masterable, Berechenbarkeit, Beherrschung]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Descartes/Pascal laugh about “motus est actus…” because can’t view what showed itself clearly to Aristotle: kinēsis, movedness as phenomenon > since Galileo, phora masters entire field, mathematical project of nature on basis (aufgrund) of homogenous space [nature as calculable, as masterable, Berechenbarkeit, Beherrschung]

HDG.FS.content: technology not grounded in physics, physics grounded in essence of technology > [Kant establishes program of program] physics observes nature as succession [series, sequence] of things, not as course of things emerging (hervorgehenden) from each other [like Aristotle]

HDG.FS.linkedContent: technology not grounded in physics, physics grounded in essence of technology > [Kant establishes program of program] physics observes nature as succession [series, sequence] of things, not as course of things emerging (hervorgehenden) from each other [like Aristotle]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”

HDG.FS.content: the 2 possibilities of end of physics: 1) open to entirely new relation to nature 2) after research concludes settle into thoughtless exploitation (gedankenlosen Ausbeutung) of the discovery (Entdeckung)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.FS.linkedContent: the 2 possibilities of end of physics: 1) open to entirely new relation to nature 2) after research concludes settle into thoughtless exploitation (gedankenlosen Ausbeutung) of the discovery (Entdeckung)

HDG.FS.content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.FS.linkedContent: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

HDG.MA.content: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.MA.linkedContent: Nobel prize winners declare “Science is a road to a happier human life” > this statement as far as possible from reflective insight into our age, forget to ponder/ask: what is ground that enabled modern technology to discover/set free new energies in nature? > nature has become a “gigantic gasoline station” [Ge-stell] (technical epoch developed in 17th century Europe)

HDG.CCP.content: behold man’s nature w/out looking at man (look away from thinking?)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: behold man’s nature w/out looking at man (look away from thinking?)

HDG.CCP.content: nature of thinking perhaps fixed in Gelassenheit, if we don’t conceive of it as re-presenting [effort & attention risks representing nature of thinking] > what am I to do? nothing but wait > what are we to wait for? no one knows—but don’t give up your path
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: nature of thinking perhaps fixed in Gelassenheit, if we don’t conceive of it as re-presenting [effort & attention risks representing nature of thinking] > what am I to do? nothing but wait > what are we to wait for? no one knows—but don’t give up your path

HDG.CCP.content: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]

HDG.CCP.content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

HDG.CCP.content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.CCP.content: we are already appropriated to Gegnet [so why wait?] > a restless to and fro btwn yes/no, suspended (hängen) btwn the 2, our stand in this betweenness (diesem Zwischen) [cf. Introduction to Metaphysics…stand in contradiction (p.82?)] is waiting > we presage (ahnen) [cf. Basic Concepts] the nature of thinking as releasement (only to forget Gelassenheit again) > thinking isn’t self-subsisting releasement: it’s the regioning of releasement, releasing releasement into Gegnet
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: we are already appropriated to Gegnet [so why wait?] > a restless to and fro btwn yes/no, suspended (hängen) btwn the 2, our stand in this betweenness (diesem Zwischen) [cf. Introduction to Metaphysics…stand in contradiction (p.82?)] is waiting > we presage (ahnen) [cf. Basic Concepts] the nature of thinking as releasement (only to forget Gelassenheit again) > thinking isn’t self-subsisting releasement: it’s the regioning of releasement, releasing releasement into Gegnet

HDG.CCP.content: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: [math & science unfold man’s historical character] any examination that focuses on what is part of history must be historical > a broad sense of history, historical rests in Gegnet > nothing but wait for man’s nature [not realized in rationality of animal?] in releasement to Gegnet, which conceals its own nature > we presage [lookup] Gelassenheit as sought for thinking [no arrival?] > we will non-willing when we let ourselves into Gelassenheit of Gegnet

HDG.CCP.content: steadfastness (Ausdauer) hidden in Gelassenheit: Gelassenheit becomes increasingly clearer about its inner nature, being steadfast, stands w/in this > the composure (Verhaltenheit) of Gelassenheit > could correspond to highest willing, but could not > “in-dwelling (Inständigkeit)”
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: steadfastness (Ausdauer) hidden in Gelassenheit: Gelassenheit becomes increasingly clearer about its inner nature, being steadfast, stands w/in this > the composure (Verhaltenheit) of Gelassenheit > could correspond to highest willing, but could not > “in-dwelling (Inständigkeit)”

HDG.CCP.content: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: thinking as commemoration (Andenken), akin to what is noble (Edlen) > night entices you to exult > exulting in waiting, become more waitful & more void > emptier, but richer in contingencies [risk, chance] > noble is what has origins [cf. Nietzsche’s On the Genea…] > noble abides in origins of its nature [habituate to your heart?]

HDG.CCP.content: man thinks, is released—to that which is prior to everything > man is released to Gegnet because this release belongs essentially to Gegnet, can’t be a coming forth of all natures w/out man [Being needs man] > can’t be conceived so long as we represent it to ourselves [can we avoid representational thought/writing?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: man thinks, is released—to that which is prior to everything > man is released to Gegnet because this release belongs essentially to Gegnet, can’t be a coming forth of all natures w/out man [Being needs man] > can’t be conceived so long as we represent it to ourselves [can we avoid representational thought/writing?]

HDG.CCP.content: (only an assertion re: relation of truth to man) truth remains independent of man: Gegnet uses man’s nature (Gelassenheit to Gegnet) w/ respect to man and to sustain determining [of things] [Schelling on independence in Investiga…Human Freedom] > man is he who’s made use of nature of truth
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: (only an assertion re: relation of truth to man) truth remains independent of man: Gegnet uses man’s nature (Gelassenheit to Gegnet) w/ respect to man and to sustain determining [of things] [Schelling on independence in Investiga…Human Freedom] > man is he who’s made use of nature of truth

HDG.CCP.content: nature of thinking can’t be said in a single word [still on path] > [scholar now keeps a word he is thinking secret, momentarily] was not my discovery, merely a scholarly thought: a historical reminder

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

HDG.CCP.linkedContent: nature of thinking can’t be said in a single word [still on path] > [scholar now keeps a word he is thinking secret, momentarily] was not my discovery, merely a scholarly thought: a historical reminder

HDG.CCP.content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called

HDG.DL.content: [on “language is the house of Being”] gives a hint (Wink) of nature of language > you’ve just said a freeing word (lösendes Wort) > Dann wäre der Wink der Grundzug des Wortes [the hint as the basic character of the word > but, p. 25 don’t let notion of hinting become guiding concept (Leitbegriff) (then we bundle up everything)] > Japaner senses (spüre) [trace] a kinship btwn phrase & a Japanese word [Koto ba, but at this point, remains unnamed]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.DL.linkedContent: [on “language is the house of Being”] gives a hint (Wink) of nature of language > you’ve just said a freeing word (lösendes Wort) > Dann wäre der Wink der Grundzug des Wortes [the hint as the basic character of the word > but, p. 25 don’t let notion of hinting become guiding concept (Leitbegriff) (then we bundle up everything)] > Japaner senses (spüre) [trace] a kinship btwn phrase & a Japanese word [Koto ba, but at this point, remains unnamed]

HDG.DL.content: nature of German language must have come over him like a waterfall (Sturzbach), when Japaner translated “Letter on Humanism,” Hölderlin’s “Homecoming,” Kleist’s Penthesilea and Amphityron > while translating, sensed wellspring of reality (Wesensquell) was the same for the fundamentally different (grundverschiedenen) languages

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")
motif.title: TRANSLATION / BABEL in TB (BENJAMIN'S "TASK OF THE TRANSLATOR")

HDG.DL.linkedContent: nature of German language must have come over him like a waterfall (Sturzbach), when Japaner translated “Letter on Humanism,” Hölderlin’s “Homecoming,” Kleist’s Penthesilea and Amphityron > while translating, sensed wellspring of reality (Wesensquell) was the same for the fundamentally different (grundverschiedenen) languages

HDG.DL.content: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: since Being and Time, bring out Being of beings (not in metaphysical manner [overcoming metaphysics]), so Being itself will shine out: the presence of present things (Anwesen des Anwesenden), two-fold of two in their simple oneness (Einfalt) > language: the prevailing (Vorwaltende) and bearing up (Tragende) in relation (Bezug) of human nature to two-fold > man realizes (west) [his nature] as man by corresponding (entspricht) to the call (Zuspruch) [promise?] of two-fold, bears witness (bekundet) to two-fold in its message (Botschaft)

HDG.DL.content: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY
motif.title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

HDG.DL.linkedContent: language: fundamental trait (Grundzug) im hermeneutischen Bezug des Menschenwesens zur Zwiefalt von Anwesen und Anwesendem [in human nature’s relation to twofold of presence & present beings] > [we must] hear “Bezug” in this statement in a totally other way > not Bezug of demand (Brauchen) & supply (Beibringen) of commodities (Waren), man not a commodity > but man in his essence is in demand (gebraucht), this need claims him (beansprucht) > man is really man when “im Brauch (needed & used by…)” that which calls (ruft) him to preserve (verwahren) twofold

HDG.DL.content: “originarily familiar (anfänglich Vertraute)”: what is entrusted to our nature, becomes known last [the only thing Heidegger’s thinking pursues, proximity to meaning of Being, etc.]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: “originarily familiar (anfänglich Vertraute)”: what is entrusted to our nature, becomes known last [the only thing Heidegger’s thinking pursues, proximity to meaning of Being, etc.]

HDG.DL.content: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

HDG.DL.content: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: transformation (Verwandlung) of thinking occurs as a passage (Wanderung), one site left for another, sites placed in discussion (Erörterung), one site (Ort) is metaphysics, the other we leave w/out a name [overcoming metaphysics] > in leaving behind metaphysics, Heidegger leaves behind aesthetics grounded in metaphysics: in such a way that we can give thought to nature of aesthetics, direct it back (verweisen) w/in its boundaries

HDG.DL.content: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

HDG.DL.content: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.DL.linkedContent: is the dialogue from out of the nature of language? mustn’t it first enter into a hearing that at once (sogleich) reaches (einzulassen) essence of language? > Heidegger once called this strange relation hermeneutic circle, exists wherever relation of message & message-bearer prevails (waltet) > message-bearer must come from message, but also must have gone toward it [affirm man’s habit, attention to Being, etc.] > but Heidegger will abandon circle, talk of it is always superficial p. 52 reach a corresponding saying of language [rather than speak about hermeneutic circle]

HDG.LP.content: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LP.linkedContent: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature

HDG.LP.content: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm
HDG.LP.linkedContent: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm

HDG.LP.content: soul is strange on earth (Wesen of soul), always underway, follows the draw (Zug) of its nature > earth where the soul’s wandering can’t reach, soul seeks (sucht) the earth [Schelling], such poetic wandering builds/dwells on earth, can save (retten) the earth as earth
HDG.LP.linkedContent: soul is strange on earth (Wesen of soul), always underway, follows the draw (Zug) of its nature > earth where the soul’s wandering can’t reach, soul seeks (sucht) the earth [Schelling], such poetic wandering builds/dwells on earth, can save (retten) the earth as earth

HDG.LP.content: the indeterminacy of man [via Trakl] means man is all too firmly confirmed as factum (Tatsache) [factical life], not yet been gathered/brought (gebracht) to firm ground (Feste), “home,” in das Einheimische ihres verhüllten Wesens > Western-European metaphysics may be struggling in vain, its way to the Unterwegs may be blocked: modern man is the animal not yet determined (fest-gestellte Tier) in its nature
HDG.LP.linkedContent: the indeterminacy of man [via Trakl] means man is all too firmly confirmed as factum (Tatsache) [factical life], not yet been gathered/brought (gebracht) to firm ground (Feste), “home,” in das Einheimische ihres verhüllten Wesens > Western-European metaphysics may be struggling in vain, its way to the Unterwegs may be blocked: modern man is the animal not yet determined (fest-gestellte Tier) in its nature

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]

HDG.LP.content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

HDG.LP.linkedContent: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

HDG.LP.content: solitude (Einsame) carries soul toward the One (Einzigen), the burden (Schwere) of fate: carry the soul toward the spirit > soul’s melancholy glows when Soul in journey enters the widest width of its properness (ihres eigenen), which is wandering > soul’s greatness, achieve flaming vision (Anschauen), becomes at home (proper) in pain [pain as MOP?]: pain’s nature is in itself converse (gegenwendiges)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: solitude (Einsame) carries soul toward the One (Einzigen), the burden (Schwere) of fate: carry the soul toward the spirit > soul’s melancholy glows when Soul in journey enters the widest width of its properness (ihres eigenen), which is wandering > soul’s greatness, achieve flaming vision (Anschauen), becomes at home (proper) in pain [pain as MOP?]: pain’s nature is in itself converse (gegenwendiges)

HDG.LP.content: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity
HDG.LP.linkedContent: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity

HDG.LP.content: pain is the favor/benignity (Gunst) in nature of all essential being > the onefold simplicity (Einfalt) of its converse (gegenwendigen) nature “determines (bestimmt) all becoming out of concealed primal earliness, and attunes (stimmt) it to the bright serenity of the great soul”
HDG.LP.linkedContent: pain is the favor/benignity (Gunst) in nature of all essential being > the onefold simplicity (Einfalt) of its converse (gegenwendigen) nature “determines (bestimmt) all becoming out of concealed primal earliness, and attunes (stimmt) it to the bright serenity of the great soul”

HDG.LP.content: as gathering, apartness has the nature of a site
HDG.LP.linkedContent: as gathering, apartness has the nature of a site

HDG.LP.content: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind

HDG.WL.content: are we so fully in language that we experience its nature? or is way to language longest road for our thinking?

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: are we so fully in language that we experience its nature? or is way to language longest road for our thinking?

HDG.WL.content: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth
HDG.WL.linkedContent: acc. Aristotle [classical architectonic (Baugefüge) structure of language], letters show sounds, sounds show passions of soul, passions of soul show matters that arouse them (be-treffenden Sachen) > showing (Zeigen) holds up this classical structure > relation btwn Showing and what it shows (Gezeigten) becomes conventional relation btwn sign (Zeichen) & its signification (Bezeichnetem) > transformation (Änderung) of sign from something that shows (Zeigenden) to something that designates (Bezeichnenden): a change in the nature of truth

HDG.WL.content: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Humboldt regards language as a world and world view (Weltansicht) > he doesn’t think language as language, but language as chief source of historical-spiritual development of man > language as a world view of a human subjectivity > Humboldt reads language as energeia, but thinks energeia in wholly un-Greek manner, via Leibniz’s monadology as activity of subject: language is turned in direction of man > Humboldt doesn’t consider the Sprachwesen (linguistic nature) of the nature of language (Wesen der Sprache): the being of language, that it abides (währt), remains gathered in what it grants itself

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.WL.content: speaking as listening to language, lets saying be said to it > this letting can obtain (er-geben) insofar as our nature has been admitted/entered (eingelassen) into Sage > we hear Saying because we belong w/in it, such is the granting that abides in Saying (in der Sage währt solches Gewähren) > essence/presence of language in Sage as source of such a grant

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: speaking as listening to language, lets saying be said to it > this letting can obtain (er-geben) insofar as our nature has been admitted/entered (eingelassen) into Sage > we hear Saying because we belong w/in it, such is the granting that abides in Saying (in der Sage währt solches Gewähren) > essence/presence of language in Sage as source of such a grant

HDG.WL.content: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Heidegger comments on risk of calling Sprachwesen Saying, might we be elevating language to a fantastical, self-sustained being (Wesen) that can’t be encountered > but language is bound up w/ human speaking, needs human speaking > perhaps we miss the very nature of language when we ask after grounds > or is Sage: the abode of rest (Be-Ruhende), grants the quiet of mutual belonging to all w/in Gefüge des Sprachwesens?

HDG.WL.content: Ereignis is plainest, most gentle of laws (Gesetz) > Ereignis is the law, gathers mortals into appropriateness (Ereignen) of their nature, and holds them therein
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Ereignis is plainest, most gentle of laws (Gesetz) > Ereignis is the law, gathers mortals into appropriateness (Ereignen) of their nature, and holds them therein

HDG.WL.content: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend

HDG.WL.content: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: way: to bring way forth, to be the way > Ereignis appropriates man to its own usage (Brauch) > Ereignis is the way-making for Saying to come into language > way-making (Be-wëgung) puts essence of language as language (Sage) into language > the way to language has transformed along the way [when we attend], via human activity, shifted to appropriating nature of language > only appears as a shift (Verlagerung) to us, w/ re: to ourselves > [Heidegger adds Gelassenheit as term to describe us listening freely to this appropriating nature of language]

HDG.WL.content: [re: Ge-stell (Framing)] speaking challenged to correspond totally to Ge-stell, in which all present beings (Anwesenden) can be commandeered, speaking turns to information > informs itself about itself to safeguard its procedures > formalization (calculated availability [rechnerische Bestellbarkeit] of Saying) is goal/norm > even to say that nature of language can’t become part of formalism’s calculations, “natural language” being described negatively

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: [re: Ge-stell (Framing)] speaking challenged to correspond totally to Ge-stell, in which all present beings (Anwesenden) can be commandeered, speaking turns to information > informs itself about itself to safeguard its procedures > formalization (calculated availability [rechnerische Bestellbarkeit] of Saying) is goal/norm > even to say that nature of language can’t become part of formalism’s calculations, “natural language” being described negatively

HDG.WL.content: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: Saying has already overtaken (überholt) destructiveness of information-language because Appropriation can’t be commandeered (Unbestellbaren des Ereignisses)? > all true language (eigentliche Sprache), because sent/assigned/destined (geschickt) by way-making of Saying, is in the nature of destiny (dadurch geschicklich) > no natural language of human w/out destiny, all language is historical > information-language too is historical, in sense of limits of present era > this era begins nothing new, only carries the old aspects of modern age to the extreme

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.WL.linkedContent: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.WL.content: man can never step out of language & look at it from somewhere else, only see its nature to the extent it has appropriated us to itself > that we cannot know the nature of language is an advantage (Vorzug), we’re favored w/in a special realm (ausgezeichneten Bereich), where we are needed/used (Gebrauchten) by language, where we dwell as mortals

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

HDG.TC.content: discovery of technology unleashed powers of nature as process of annihilation encompassing earth

HDG.OHF.content: [preliminary descriptions of ready-to-hand & present-at-hand] total domain of what’s real: 1) things in nature 2) things of value > authentic being of table: material thing in space [?] [given “in the flesh (leibhafte)”]
